title: Creamy Garlic Chicken Spanakopita Skillet Recipe
full_text:
Creamy Garlic Chicken Spanakopita Skillet Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
45 mins
Active
40 mins
Total
50 mins
Serves
6
to 8 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
pound
fresh
baby spinach
leaves, washed
6
tablespoons
unsalted butter
, divided
1 1/2
pounds
boneless, skinless chicken breasts
or thighs, chopped into 1-inch chunks
Kosher salt
and freshly
ground black pepper
5
medium
cloves garlic
, minced
2
tablespoons
all-purpose flour
1/2
cup
homemade chicken stock
or
low-sodium broth
, plus more as needed
1/2
cup
half-and-half
6
ounces
feta cheese
, crumbled
3
scallions
, white and light green parts only, chopped
1
small bunch
dill
, chopped, plus more for garnish
6 to 8
sheets
phyllo dough
, thawed and covered with a towel
Directions
Heat a large cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add spinach, a handful at a time, until the pan is full; you may have to cook the spinach in batches to ensure that it cooks evenly. Turn the spinach often until just wilted, then transfer to a colander and press out as much water as you can. Continue until all of the spinach is wilted and pressed.
Serious Eats / Morgan Eisenberg
Pour off any excess water in the skillet and place back over medium heat. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in the pan and add chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Cook, turning once, until the edges are lightly golden, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Melt 2 tablespoons butter in same skillet and add garlic. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute, then mix in flour. Stir together until the mixture forms a golden paste. Whisk in 1/2 cup chicken stock. Cook, stirring often, until mixture is thickened and coats the back of a spoon. Whisk in half-and-half.
Stir together feta cheese, scallions, and dill, allowing the feta to melt. Remove from heat. Return chicken and spinach to skillet, mixing well. If the sauce has thickened too much, add more chicken stock to reach the desired consistency, keeping in mind that the mixture will thicken even more when baking in the oven. Season with salt and pepper.
Serious Eats / Morgan Eisenberg
Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan or in the microwave. Lay a sheet of phyllo on a work surface. Brush with melted butter, then scrunch up the sheet and set it on top of the spinach mixture in the skillet. Repeat with remaining phyllo until the skillet is completely covered.
Serious Eats / Morgan Eisenberg
Bake until phyllo is golden and crisp on top, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven, garnish with additional dill, and serve warm.
Special Equipment
Cast iron skillet
, pastry brush
Savory
Feta Cheese
Chicken Breast
Chicken Thighs
Spinach
